snippet: The Mets have appealed to have R. A. Dickey’s one-hitter on Wednesday rescored as a no-hitter, lobbying for third baseman David Wright to be given an error on a play in the first inning.
abstract: New York Mets appeal to have pitcher R A Dickey's one-hitter against the Tampa Bay Rays rescored as a no-hitter, contending that B J Upton's first-inning infield single should have been score an error on Mets third baseman David Wright; moves puts the team in the awkward position of trying to assign a negative statistic to one of its players.
lead_paragraph: The Mets have appealed to have R. A. Dickey’s one-hitter on Wednesday rescored as a no-hitter, lobbying for third baseman David Wright to be given an error on a play in the first inning.

headline.seo: In Appeal, Mets Say Wright (and Scorer) Erred in One-Hitter
headline.print_headline: Mets Are in a Pickle on an Appeal
